pull.title: Accept unordered tracepoints in interface_usdt_utxocache.py
pull.body:
We have encountered an instance where the tracepoints were not collected in the same order they were fired (#31951).

Tracepoint ordering is not guaranteed in userspace for a number of reasons.

As this test does not require a strict collection/processing order collect `expected` and `actual` events into dicts and compare them.

This will gracefully handle both the number of events, and out-of-order events should they reoccur in the future.

Fixes: #31951

events.body:

### Reviews

| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [laanwj](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32101#pullrequestreview-2717503724), [0xB10C](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32101#issuecomment-2755174173) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

ACK 693d1e2f54baa0d5e407153f79b2f98385e6b8d9

I successfully ran the changed test a couple of times and the code changes look good to me.

That this behavior works as intended can be tested with this patch:

```patch
diff --git a/test/functional/interface_usdt_utxocache.py b/test/functional/interface_usdt_utxocache.py
index d4213d5020..94ec23c51a 100755
--- a/test/functional/interface_usdt_utxocache.py
+++ b/test/functional/interface_usdt_utxocache.py
@@ -326,6 +326,7 @@ class UTXOCacheTracepointTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
                 event.is_coinbase
             )

+        expected_utxocache_adds.reverse()
         expected_add_keys = {(e["txid"], e["index"], e["height"], e["value"], e["is_coinbase"])
                              for e in expected_utxocache_adds}
         expected_spent_keys = {(e["txid"], e["index"], e["height"], e["value"], e["is_coinbase"])
```

test: accept unordered tracepoints in...

We have encountered an instance where the tracepoints were not collected

Tracepoint ordering is not guaranteed in userspace for a number of
reasons.

As this test does not require a strict collection/processing order
collect `expected` and `actual` events into dicts and compare them.

This will gracefully handle both the number of events, and out-of-order
events should they reoccur in the future.

test: accept unordered tracepoints in...

...interface_usdt_utxocache.py

We have encountered an instance where the tracepoints were not collected
in the same order they were fired (#31951).

Tracepoint ordering is not guaranteed in userspace for a number of
reasons.

As this test does not require a strict collection/processing order

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -324,9 +316,26 @@ def handle_utxocache_spent(_, data, __):
 
         self.log.info(
             f"check that we successfully traced {EXPECTED_HANDLE_ADD_SUCCESS} adds and {EXPECTED_HANDLE_SPENT_SUCCESS} spent")
-        for expected_utxo, actual_event in zip(expected_utxocache_adds + expected_utxocache_spents,
-                                               actual_utxocache_adds + actual_utxocache_spents):
-            compare_utxo_with_event(expected_utxo, actual_event)
+
comments.body: Maybe add a comment about the events possible arriving out of order (to make it clear why this is done without the context of this PR).
